page.title: 13THE BIKE DEBATE. PRO.
page.content: {FOR.}At Silvington there is a moto cross grass track. There is a little coppice in the field and you have to go through the brook at two points. Matthew is in the Wyre Forest moto cross club. There are some very deep holes and there you have to keep in a low gear. Matt came off twice in "the bog" which is the most difficult section of the course. Matthew writes, "People say that moto cross is dangerous and people are killed but its not true. People kill themselves on the roads but in moto cross I wear protective gear. Your bike is checked when you sign in. A well organised club event is safe . I wear boots with plastic shin guards. I wear a chest protector and a body belt." Susan lives near the course and has seen riders from 4 years to 20 years old motor cycle racing.
